products.title: HP Veer 4G
products.description:
The Veer is a touchscreen smart phone from the HP company developed in conjunction with Palm. Utilizing a small, lightweight design, this model functions as a successor to the Palm Pixi and Pixi Plus devices. Featuring a 2.6-inch multi-touch display, the Veer runs HP's own webOS operating system with Microsoft Exchange for unified email synchronization. A full-sized sliding QWERTY keyboard is included for improved communications accuracy, while a 5-megapixel digital camera provides depth-of-field clarity for optimal image and video capture. 8 gigabytes of internal storage are available to store a user's audio, video and image files, with USB 2.0 connectivity for one-step transferring. GPS support provides accurate locational data virtually anywhere Edge data can be accessed, utilizing advanced triangulation technology for results within a 10-meter radius. In addition, the Veer can be configured to act as a WiFi router for up to five other devices, utilizing HP's "Mobile Hotspot" function to collect and re-assign wireless internet signals. 

Testing.

Features

  • Matte Black aesthetic
  • 2.6-inch multi-touch display
  • HP webOS platform
  • Slide-out physical QWERTY keyboard
  • Microsoft Exchange email synchronization service 
  • 5-megapixel camera with geo-tagging and video capture
  • 8GB internal memory storage
  • USB 2.0 connectivity 
  • HP TouchStone compatibility

pros.text: tiny and lightweight - very easily pocketable
runs WebOS 2.0 - native multitasking, decent app selection
decent hardware for such a tiny device - 800MHz Qualcomm Snapdragon MSM7230, 512MB memory
slide-out backlit Palm-style QWERTY keyboard with strong hinge

cons.text: no dedicated 3.5mm headphone jack - built in to the proprietary charge/sync port
lots of jagged edges on content meant for larger displays
more money than the larger and more capable Pre 2
small and odd size is not ergonomic to hold - will lead to lots of tumbles
